markdown:
While the other primal dragons hail from the Elemental Planes, the cruel and unceasingly malicious umbral dragons originate in the depths of the Shadow Plane. Their sleek black scales and serpentine grace allow them to strike from hiding, and they are known for playing with their prey before finally finishing it. These creatures of shadowy energy and unwholesome appetites prefer the necrotic flesh of undead creatures to any other meal. This strange hunger can be of accidental benefit to nearby humanoid societies, but ultimately they hunt and kill undead creatures for the taste, rather than out of any desire to protect others from the undead. The benefit is always short-lived, however. When umbral dragons exhaust their preferred prey, they turn on whatever living creatures happen to be nearby. Umbral dragons sometimes go to great lengths to obtain their favorite meals, even creating undead creatures that they then feast upon. For all their power, umbral dragons are uninterested in fair battles. When faced with foes that pose any kind of actual danger to them, umbral dragons flee into the shadows and seek to strike back through pawns or minions rather than risk their own lives. Their treasure hoards are varied and diverse, often augmented by loot stolen from crypts the dragons have turned into feeding grounds. They have a strong respect for and interest in traditions and heirlooms, and they often seek to augment their hoards with items of great value that have been handed down through the generations of those whose corpses and ghosts they've fed upon. **[Recall Knowledge - Dragon](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2)): DC 45 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 43 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 40 [Ancient Umbral Dragon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=636) **Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 97 2.0 **Perception** +36; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent (imprecise) 60 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33), [tremorsense (imprecise) 60 feet](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=40) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Daemonic](/Languages.aspx?ID=31), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Shadowtongue](/Languages.aspx?ID=21) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +33, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +38, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +34, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +36, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +34, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +35, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +34 **Str** +10 **Dex** +5 **Con** +7 **Int** +6 **Wis** +8 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 45 **Fort** +35 **Ref** +33 **Will** +38 +1 status to all saves vs. magic **HP** 375 **Immunities** negative, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [sleep](/Traits.aspx?ID=145) **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 90 feet, DC 40
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** Jaws only. --- **Speed** 60 feet, fly 200 feet **Melee** jaws +38 ([Negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d10+18 piercing plus 4d6 negative and drain vigor **Melee** claw +38 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d10+18 slashing **Melee** tail +36 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 25 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d12+18 slashing **Melee** wing +36 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d10+18 slashing **Primal Innate Spells** DC 42 - **Cantrips (10th)** [Detect Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=66) - **8th** [Vampiric Exsanguination](/Spells.aspx?ID=353) (at will) - **9th** [Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=59) (at will), [Finger of Death](/Spells.aspx?ID=116) - **10th** [Massacre](/Spells.aspx?ID=186) **Rituals** DC 42 - **2nd** [Create Undead](/Rituals.aspx?ID=10) (shadows only) **Breath Weapon** The umbral dragon breathes in one of two ways. They can't use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds.
  • **Negative** ([necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The dragon breathes a blast of darkness in a 50-foot cone that deals 21d6 negative damage (DC 42 basic Reflex save). Undead creatures take 25d6 force damage instead of the negative damage.
  • **Shadows** ([necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143)) The dragon breathes a blast of shadows in a 50-foot cone. Each creature within the cone must attempt a DC 42 Fortitude save.
    **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
    **Success** The creature is [enfeebled 3](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) for 1 round.
    **Failure** The creature is enfeebled 3 for 1 minute.
    **Critical Failure** The creature is enfeebled 3 for 1 minute and [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1 round.
**Draconic Frenzy** The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order. **Draconic Momentum** The dragon recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike. **Drain Vigor** ([Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) When the dragon deals negative damage to a living creature with its jaws Strike, the umbral dragon gains 20 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a DC 41 Fortitude save or become [enfeebled 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13). Further damage dealt by the dragon's jaws Strike increases the enfeebled condition value by 2 on a failed save, to a maximum of enfeebled 4. **Ghost Bane** An umbral dragon's Strikes affect [incorporeal](/Traits.aspx?ID=222) creatures with the effects of a [ghost touch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297) property rune, and an umbral dragon's jaws deal an additional 8d6 force damage to [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160).
name: Ancient Umbral Dragon

Their sleek black scales and serpentine grace allow them to strike from hiding, and they are known for playing with their prey before finally finishing it. The benefit is always short-lived, however. When umbral dragons exhaust their preferred prey, they turn on whatever living creatures happen to be nearby. Umbral dragons sometimes go to great lengths to obtain their favorite meals, even creating undead creatures that they then feast upon. For all their power, umbral dragons are uninterested in fair battles. When faced with foes that pose any kind of actual danger to them, umbral dragons flee into the shadows and seek to strike back through pawns or minions rather than risk their own lives. Draconic Frenzy Two Actions The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order. Further damage dealt by the dragon's jaws Strike increases the enfeebled condition value by 2 on a failed save, to a maximum of enfeebled 4.
